info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 28 at 3:11PM CDT by NWS North Platte NE
info.description:
At 310 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking gusty showers along a line extending from 11 miles southeast of Kilgore to 7 miles south of Merritt Reservoir to 15 miles north of Mullen. Movement was east at 30 mph.
HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph.
SOURCE...Radar indicated.
IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects.
Locations impacted include... Valentine, Johnstown, Brownlee, Valentine National Wildlife Refuge, Merritt Reservoir, Norden, Wood Lake, Moon Lake, North River Trail, Sparks, Highway 83 crossing the North Loup River, Marsh Flat, Smith Falls State Park, Schlagel Creek State Wildlife Management Area, Highway 97 crossing the Niobrara River, Highway 97 crossing Big Creek, Big Alkali Lake State Wildlife Management Area, and Highway 83 crossing Goose Creek.
This includes the following highways... Highway 20 between mile markers 190 and 234. Highway 97 between mile markers 78 and 90, and between mile markers 97 and 141. Highway 83 between mile markers 164 and 216. Highway 12 between mile markers 1 and 6, and between mile markers 12 and 36.
info.instruction:
If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

parameter.value: GUSTY SHOWERS WILL IMPACT EASTERN CHERRY...NORTHWESTERN BROWN AND WESTERN KEYA PAHA COUNTIES THROUGH 400 PM CDT

area.areaDesc: Eastern Cherry; Keya Paha; Brown; Western Cherry
